qas.question: What year was the beginning of enemy bombing first promoted by Hitler?
Who had skepticism towards strategic bombing?
Why did Hitler feel bombing wasn't working?
In 1939 Hitler said bombing of Britain would begin when?
Why did Hitler feel the Luftwaffe was unsuccessful in bombing raids?

context: <a1_0>Adolf Hitler<a1_0/> failed to pay as much attention to bombing the enemy as he did to protection from enemy bombing, although he had promoted the development of a bomber force in the <a0_0>1930s<a0_0/> and understood that it was possible to use bombers for major strategic purposes. He told the OKL in 1939 that ruthless employment of the Luftwaffe against the heart of the British will to resist could and would follow when <a3_0>the moment was right<a3_0/>; however, he quickly developed a lively scepticism toward strategic bombing, confirmed by the results of the Blitz. He frequently complained of the Luftwaffe's <a2_0>inability to damage industries<a2_0/> sufficiently, saying, "The munitions industry cannot be interfered with effectively by air raids ... usually the <a4_0>prescribed targets are not hit<a4_0/>".
